title: fix: budget validation for purchase orders (backport #40769)
body:
### Bug

Validation for budget fails even though the actual expense in Purchase Orders is less than the budget amount.

When the `get_amount` function is called for getting the expenses that will occur through Purchase Orders, the actual expense for purchase invoices is added once.

https://github.com/frappe/erpnext/blob/8e522183bc417b52253315cd3784a125eea671d8/erpnext/accounts/doctype/budget/budget.py#L302-L311

However, when validation runs, the actual expense is added again to the total amount to compare against the budget amount.

https://github.com/frappe/erpnext/blob/8e522183bc417b52253315cd3784a125eea671d8/erpnext/accounts/doctype/budget/budget.py#L252-L256

<hr>

### Fix 

- Add expense amount only once to the total expense before validating against the budget amount.

title: fix: budget validation for purchase orders (backport #40769)
body:
### Bug

Validation for budget fails even though the actual expense in Purchase Orders is less than the budget amount.

When the `get_amount` function is called for getting the expenses that will occur through Purchase Orders, the actual expense for purchase invoices is added once.

https://github.com/frappe/erpnext/blob/8e522183bc417b52253315cd3784a125eea671d8/erpnext/accounts/doctype/budget/budget.py#L302-L311

However, when validation runs, the actual expense is added again to the total amount to compare against the budget amount.

https://github.com/frappe/erpnext/blob/8e522183bc417b52253315cd3784a125eea671d8/erpnext/accounts/doctype/budget/budget.py#L252-L256

<hr>

### Fix 

- Add expense amount only once to the total expense before validating against the budget amount.
- Show breakup of expenses booked through Actual Expenses, Material Requests, Unbilled Orders with links to relevant reports.

Documentation section Link: https://docs.erpnext.com/docs/user/manual/en/journals-and-payments-payment-terms

This pull request introduces a new option for "Due Date Based On" in the Payment Term . The new option, "Month(s) after invoice date," allows users to specify a due date that is calculated based on a certain number of months after the posting date of the invoice or order.

Description of the New Option for "Due date based on":

Month(s) after invoice date: Due date should be calculated in months concerning the posting date of the invoice. For example, if 2 is entered on the 15th of March, the due date will be on 15th May.

body:
**Problem:**
When we create a customer group the function "validate_name_with_customer" is called which checks whether the name of customer group exists in "Customer" DocType.
For e.g.
If we create a customer group called "XYZ",  in the on_update method in customer_group.py file, the code will check whether a customer with a name of "XYZ" is already created or not. If it is created it throws an error "A customer with the same name already exists".



**Solution:**
Remove validate_name_with_customer from "customer_group.py" file.
